comment.body: That's a fair point. The `.dist` is actually a legacy artifact from how I was setting up most of my projects. I would actually prefer to see the `phpunit.xml.dist` file renamed to `phpunit.xml`. We can then remove this from `.gitignore`. No other changes should be necessary.

issue.title: Differentiate between a test failure and test error
issue.body: A test is considered not-passing in one of two ways in our current system; the test failed or the test was disabled. Failure occurs if _any_ exception is thrown during the test. This is not an accurate representation of what has actually occurred within the test. A _failure_ should be when an assertion has occurred or the test explicitly throws a `TestFailedException`. An exception that is not expected or was thrown in error should not be considered a failure. It should be considered an _error_ and should throw a `TestErrorException`. The CLI result printer should differentiate between a test failing and a test encountering an unexpected error. The difference between these 2 types of exceptions is important enough to ensure the end-user receives this information.

issue.title: Show better information about data set being tested
issue.body: When writing a test with `#[DataProvider]` if the test fails or encounters some error more information should be displayed about _which_ data set failed. Tests should also be implemented to ensure that the data set label being a custom string works as expected.

review.body: Hi! Thank you for submitting this fix. I made some comments on minor adjustments that should be made. Once the changes have been put in place I'll be happy to merge this in.
